OpenGenderTracking Project
Computationally Tracking Gender in News Content

About

The OpenGenderTracking project aims to build software that assists with analyzing the gender balance of news content.

Goals

Our initial goal is to create a standalone service that accepts content and is able to provide metrics about its gender balance. The service will be extendable to allow different sources of content, and have a variety of metrics that will return the gender balance of the content provided.

Who

OpenGenderTracker is a project by Irene Ros and Adam Hyland from Bocoup in collaboration with Nathan Matias of the MIT Center for Civic Media.

Bocoup moves the Open Web forward by building and supporting tomorrow's Open Web technologies through consulting, training, and community development.

Knight Foundation supports transformational ideas that promote quality journalism, advance media innovation, engage communities and foster the arts. The foundation believes that democracy thrives when people and communities are informed and engaged.

The MIT Center for Civic Media works hand in hand with diverse communities to collaboratively create, design, deploy, and assess civic media tools and practices.

Brought to you by Bocoup and the MIT Center for Civic Media with generous support of the Knight Foundation | Find us on Github
